name: symmetrically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves having two parts that match exactly, either when one half is like an image of the other half in a mirror, or when one part can take the place of another if it is turned 90° or 180°: The specimen consists of about thirty-five symmetrically developed crystals.
in a way that involves actions or parts that are similar or balanced in some way: His book is less traditional and is less symmetrically balanced. See
symmetry
More examplesFewer examplesAny pair of numbers symmetrically placed about the center of the square sums to 17.Two symmetrically laced red bands run down the side of this watermelon green bowl.You need a strategy to apply symmetrically and based on clear rules.Fighting war symmetrically means lining up our armies against their armies, tanks against tanks.
